Package project

Class Album

java.lang.Object
project.Album
public class Album
extends java.lang.Object
The Album class is where the user's input will be split and stored into an album data type. StringTokenizer is used to split the user input into its desired sections. There are three constructors to create Album based on inputs. There are getter and setter methods for the Album's properties.
Author:
Manav Bali, Daniel Lopez

      artist - artist of album.
      genre - genre of album.
      releaseDate - releaseDate of album.

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object obj)
      Takes in a object and then checks if it is an album object. Then the current instance of album then checks against the parameter object to see if they are equal albums.
      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Used in CollectionManager before album is added. Sees if the album that is created has a valid date.
      Returns:
      boolean true if date is valid, false otherwise.

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo​(Album album)
      Used by printByDate in Collection. Comares two dates.
      Parameters:
      album - the album that is being compared.
      Returns:
      int -1 if left album is smaller than right album in terms of dates, 0 otherwise.

    • compareToGenre

      public int compareToGenre​(Album album)
      Used by printByGenre in Collection. Comares two genres.
      Parameters:
      album - the album that is being compared.
      Returns:
      int -1 if left album is smaller than right album in terms of genres, 0 otherwise.

    • returns
